medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Nine days before admission, fever and vomiting developed; vomiting resolved after 2 days, but fever continued with a maximum temperature of 39.7Â°C. On the fourth day, cough developed. Acetaminophen and ibuprofen were administered without improvement. On the seventh day, parents brought her to the emergency department due to decreased appetite, although she was drinking well. During the next 2 days, fevers persisted, cough increased, and she developed tachypnea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of pneumonia diagnosed 4 months prior, treated with a 10-day course of an unspecified oral antibiotic; previous episodes of viral gastroenteritis and acute otitis media in the 6 weeks leading to admission. No known allergies; immunizations are current.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother had asthma. The mother had a history of regional BCG disease and had undergone resection and prolonged antibiotic therapy. During pregnancy, a positive tuberculin skin test was noted but a normal chest radiograph.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in an urban area with parents and a 5-year-old sister; mother is a homemaker and father is a carpenter. The family kept canaries as pets, previously had pet cats, but none in the home for 2 months prior to admission. No travel history.
